reviewText: Excellent card!Great buy!Ric Flair defends the WCW World Title against  Barry Windham.Vader tries for the "International"World Title in a  match against Sting.Also on the show..."Stunning"Steve  Austin,Cactus Jack(Mankind,Dude Love,Mick Foley)Dustin(Goldust) Rhodes and  much more.What a bargain!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: WCW Slamboree began in 1993 and it was actually a decent event at times. This one was one of the better editions. Let's get to it:"Stunning" (Stone Cold) Steve Austin w/Col. Parker Vs. Johnny B. Badd (Marc Mero)(WCW U.S. Title Match) - This was a good opener. If all you know of Austin is the "Stone Cold" era, then you need to see this. He was a good technical wrestler in those days, on the same level with Bret Hart arguably! Austin manages to win this one due to some dirty tricks from himself and Parker to retain the title against BaddTerry Funk Vs. Tully Blanchard (Legends Match) - The former Horsemen Vs. one of the craziest men in wrestling ever! Funk, surprisingly, dominated most of this match and even tried to piledrive Tully from the top rope! Ends in a double DQ with Funk practically caning Blanchard with his branding iron!Larry Zbysko Vs. Lord Steven Regal (William Regal) - This was a grudge match. Although Regal's WCW TV Title wasn't on the line, personal pride was. I was never a Larry fan but I got to give him credit, he wrestled a very good match and actually matched the usually superior Regal in technical wrestling! Ends when Larry reversed a butterfly suplex on Regal for the win.Dustin Rhodes (Goldust) Vs. Bunkhouse Buck (Jimmy Golden) - This was a bullrope match and was probably the dullest on the card. The only good part is when Terry Funk came out and attacked Dustin Rhodes at the end. If you want to see a good Dustin/Buck match, find WCW Spring Stampede 1994 for their Bunkhouse matchup! Its much better!"Nature Boy" Ric Flair Vs. Barry Windham (WCW World Title Match) - This wasn't their greatest match but I can't recall a stinker between these two. Windham, admittedly, didn't come in the best of shape BUT he still put on a pretty good match with Flair. Ends with Flair using a rare flying bodypress on Windham for the pin.Cactus Jack/Kevin Sullivan Vs. The Nasty Boys (WCW World Tag Team Title Match) - This was a Broadstreet Bully Match, another way of saying anything goes! This is easily the best match on the card and the main reason to get this tape! Ends when Cactus hits one of the Nasties with a hockey stick! Also, there is action even after the match! This was ECW before ECW!Sting Vs. Vader (WCW International Title) - Like Flair Vs. Windham, these two have had better matches BUT this didn't stink by any means. Ends when Sting hits a top rope splash after Harley Race (who was Vader's manager) missed a diving headbutt and hit Vader! Sting takes the International belt.Overall, this wasn't WCW's best but they've had far worse. Still, it does show that while they sucked at marketing, the action (when they wanted to) could be first-rate! A good piece of wrestling history to get.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This will be my last WCW Pay Per View review unless I get comments asking me to review the shows after this if I do it will be 96 & 97. I don't want to review anything after this or before GAB 1996 cause Hogan came in & he brought guys like Brutus Beefcake in Jiim Duggan & The Honkey Tonk Man. I'm not going into that cause I don't want it to turn into a rant I want to be upbeat. On The April 30th episode of WCW Saturday Night Commissoner Nick Bockwinkle said he gave The WCW World Heavyweight Championship to Ric Flair at Spring Stampede cause any time you have a draw or an even match then the champion retains. But The Championship Committee has been investigating the situation & The WCW World title might be held up. Flair came out he felt that his credibility as champion was being questioned so he threw the title at Nick Bockwinkle he told him it's yours pal. This brought out Ricky Steamboat who said the only reason he's doing this is cause his ego so big. He said why don't you face the facts that I beat you. Later on Bockwinkle came out & said that the title has been held up & Flair & Steamboat will face each other for the held up WCW World Heavyweight Championship. On The May 14th episode of WCW Saturday Night Ric Flair defeated Ricky Steamboat for the held up title in another 5 star match. This is also an unoffical 12th title reign. Colonel Parker was involved in several storylines with Ric Flair, Dustin Rhodes & Johnny B Badd. On The April 23rd episode of WCW Saturday Night Dustin Rhodes wanted a Bull Rope Match with Bunkhouse Buck at Slamboree. The Following week on WCW Saturday Night the match was made. Then the following week on WCW Saturday Night Bunkhouse Buck cost Dustin Rhodes The US title Johnny Badd made the save when Bunkhouse Buck & Steve Austin were attacking Rhodes also Johnny B Badd got a shot at The WCW United States Championship at Slamboree. Colonel Parker had been going around with a briefcase of money for either Ric Flair or Ricky Steamboat to take when the title distpute was solved Ric Flair won of course so on The May 14th episode after winning the held up WCW World title Flair knocked out Colonel Parker & took the money cause now he had to defend the title against Colonel Parker's Mystery Man Colonel Parker said that he was a 6 foot 7 300 pound blond former World Champion. Meanwhile the following week On WCW Saturday Night Dustin Rhodes teamed up with Johnny B Badd to face Steve Austin & Bunkhouse Buck. It ended in a disqualification when Colonel Parker interfered Ric Flair came out then a Masked Mysery Man came out of nowhere attked Ric Flair it looked like he was going to finish him off with a chair Bunkhouse Buck had a rope tied around Dustin Rhodes neck & hang him. Until The Road Agents came down to stop them, On The April 23rd episode of WCW Saturday Night the main event of Slamboree was mad a grudge match between Rick Rude & Big Van Vader. The following week on WCW Saturday Night Rick Rude came out & hit Vader & Harley Race with a chair he cut a promo he said The Rude Collection Agencey is coming to collect in full. On May 1st in Fukuoka Japan Rude defeated Sting for The WCW World International Heavyweight Championship this was also the match that Rude suffered a career ending back injury. It was a very good match a lot better than their Spring Stampede match. They still were advertisied the match for The Pay Per View but they address the problem at this show. On The April 23rd episode of WCW Saturday Night it was announced that The Nasty boys would defend The WCW World Tag Team Championship against Kevin & Dave Sullivan at Slamboree. On The May 8th episode of The Main Event a stipulation was made that it would be a Broad Street Bully Match. On The May 14th episode of WCW Saturday Night Dave Sullivan was injured by The Nasty Boys backstage. Former Philadelphia Flyer Dave "The Hammer" Shultz was added as a Special Guest Referee. The Sullivan's were to have a match with Tex Slazenger & Shanghai Pierce Kevin went alone The Nasty Boys came out & double teamed Kevin Sullivan Cactus Jack came out & attacked The Nasties with a chair. Kevin Sullivan cut a promo he said he came for 2 things 1 was The Nasty Boys 2 was Cactus Jack. He told him that you didn't look out for my brother. Cactus said that he wasn't a babysitter & I should've beat you up back in 1990 but were like 2 peas in a pod since Philadelphia is The City Of Brotherly Love we should come together to face The Nasty Boys so Cactus Jack replaced Dave Sullivan. LarryZbyszko who had became an announcer for WCW had problems when he had been interviewing Steven Regal for weeks cause he kept on hatting on The US. Larry Zbyszko got tired of it & walked off of an interview. On The April 23rd episode of WCW Saturday Night Regal demanded an apology from Larry Zbyszko the following week. The next week on WCW Saturday Night Larry Zbyszko punched Sir William & ripped Regal shirt. The following week Regal wanted a match with Larry Zbyszko at Slamboree. Where the following week on WCW Saturday Night Zbyszko accepted. That is the backstory leading into Slamboree 94 the buyrate was an 0.48 that is slightly up from the 0.46 for last years Slamboree.Date May 22, 1994Attendance 4,000Venue Philadelphia Civic CenterWhen Mean Gene is introducing The Legends something odd is that Penny Banner & Johnny Weaver are 2 of the guests & I have read about when they were married that Johnny Weaver was an abusive pos.Since Rick Rude couldn't defend The World International title due to the career ending back injury WCW came up with their version to write Rick Rude out Commissoner Bockwinkle came out & said that due to Rick Rude's cheating in the match The WCW International has stripped Rude & that the belt is to be given back to Sting so Sting comes out btw he looks sharp in his sut. He said I don't want titles to be decided in board room so put the title up for grabs in the main event with Vader. Commissoner Bockwinkle agrees to his demand.WCW United States ChampionshipChampion Steve Austin with Colonel Parker Def Johnny B Badd *** & half stars a very good match 1 thing of note is that when Badd rolled up Austin the bell was rung by accident.Mean Gene then interviews Ernie Ladd & Wahoo McDaniel. Dusty Rhodes cut a promo from Hollywood cause he wasn't their for The Pay Per View.Gordon Solie joined Bobby Heenan for this next matchLegends MatchTerry Funk vs Tully Blanchard went to a double disqualification * & 3 an ok match quarters of a star & Terry Funk was very much over with The ECW crowd.Jesse Ventura interviews Ric Flair about his title defense against The Mystery Opponet.Larry Zbyszko Def Steven Regal with Sir William ** in an ok non title match on a side note the match with Zbyszko winning The WCW Televison Championship was already filmedGene Okerlund interviewed Terry Funk about why he wasn't in Legends Introduction.Gordon Solie & Lou Theze held The WCW Hall Of Fame Induction CermonyHarley Race, The Crusher, Ernie Ladd, The Masked Assassin, Ole Anderson & Dick The Bruiser with his daughter accepting were inducted into The Hall Of Fame.Jesse Ventura interviewed Colonel Parker who told him that he's going to reveal The Mystery Opponet very soon.Texas Bull Rope MatchDustin Rhodes Def Bunkhouse Buck with Colonel Parker *** a good matchMean Gene interviewed Ray Stevens & Red Bastein.Jesse Ventura joined Tony Schiavone for the next 2 matchesWCW World Heavyweight ChampionshipChampion Ric Flair Def The Mystery Opponet who turned out to be Barry Windham with Colonel Parker *** & a quarter of a star a good match better than their Beach Blast match. But still not up to the standard of Flair vs WindhamMean Gene interviewed Don Curtis & The CrusherDave Shultz cut a promo about being The Special Guest Referee he said it will be by the rules they agreed to.Broad Street Bully MatchWCW World Tag Team ChampionshipCactus Jack & Kevin Sullivan Def Champions The Nasty Boys Brian Knobs & Jerry Sags to win the titles **** & half stars 5+***** for The Nasty Boys getting their comuepanceformer Philadelphia Flyer Dave "The Hammer" Shultz was The Special Guest RefereeI'd be lying if I said I didn't like this match more than The Chicago Street Fight from Spring Stampede cause I like this match better. It is a wild brawl. After the match you had Jerry Sags  attack Cactus Jack with a hockey stick Max Payne came out hit Sags with a guitar. Cactus Jack, Payne & Kevin Sullivan chased after Brian Knobs then from the back Dave Sullivan came out & hit Knobs  with a crutch & after sitting through so many bad Nasty Boys matches they finally get their comuepance.Vancant WCW World International Heavyweight ChampionshipSting Def Big Van Vader with Harley Race to win the title *** & quarter stars another solid show The US title match Austin vs Johnny B Badd was very good. The Legends Match with Terry Funk & Tully Blanchard was what it was. Zbszko & Regal was ok. Rhodes & Bunkhouse Buck had another good match in The Bullrope match. A good match with Flair & Windham for The WCW World Heavyweight Championship. The Broad Street Bully Match Cactus Jack & Kevin Sullivan stole the show. Sting vs Vader for The WCW World International Championship was good as expected. Recommeded cuase it's great show along with Spring Stampede but like I said I won't review any WCW PPV's after this cause late 94 to early 96 is The Hogan & Friends era & WCW didn't have an identity. So next I will start reviewing WWF shows starting with Survivor Series 1995.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The Untied States title match between Steve Austin & Johnny B.Badd wasn't too bad even with the goofed finish. The Terry F-Tully Blanchard match was a definite ECW style brawl under WCW rules. The Larry Zbyszko-Lord Steven Regal match was a great atmosphere match even with the stalling & pandering to the crowd. The Bullrope match between Dustin Rhodes & Bunkhouse Buck while not a bad match,it was tame compared to the Bunkhouse Brawl they had a month earlier. The World title match between Rick Flair & Barry Windham was not great but pretty good. The Boardstreet Bully match for the World tag team titles between The Nasty Boys against the team of Cactus Jack & Kevin Sullivan was a smash-mouth,hardcore & entertaining brawl. The Sting-Vader match for the vacant International title was also not great but pretty good. I give this ppv a 8 out of 10.
Title: N/A

reviewText: All the matches were well done with the Exception with the legends match between Funk and Blanchard.Sting and Vader had another classic in their series.
Title: N/A

reviewText: WCW actually had a great product for a while, but they seemed to be awful at marketing it.  It looks to me like half of the matches on this card didn't have any buildup prior to the event, so the audience is walking into the pay-per-view blind.  That was just WCW's style I guess.First match on the card is Steve Austin vs. Johnny B. Badd.  Badd actually didn't impress me too much in this match, and I've always liked the guy.  However, Austin's at the top of his game here.  He still looks weird with hair if you ask me.Next is Terry Funk vs. Tully Blanchard.  There's no way you can possibly make this a bad match.  You've got two ultra-tough guys, one very well schooled and the other completely whacko.  I didn't see as much offense from Tully as I had hoped though.  It looked like Funk was beating the heck out of him.  When Funk attempts to piledrive Blanchard off the top rope onto a steel chair, Gordon Solie makes a comment about the match taking on "insane proportions."  Ha ha.  Blanchard should have lost the match after knocking out the referee, but it's ruled a double-DQ instead.  Then Terry Funk finds that straw hat guy who's in the front row, takes off the hat and elbow drops it.  Awesome.Then we see Zbysko against Regal.  As much as I hate Zbysko, he was pretty impressive in this match, reversing a butterfly suplex to get the win.  Of course the referee's freaking blind when Zbysko uses the ropes to aid an abdominal stretch.  Why is it so important to be within 4 inches of the guy's face when asking him if he wants to quit?  Oh well, we'll let it slide.  I'd have to say Regal probably had one of the best personalities in WCW at this time, just under Flair's, and you can really see it in this match.  You won't find a man who's more into his gimmick than Regal is right here.  Great ring psychology from a master.Ah yes, Bunkhouse Buck.  I miss this guy.  He really sells in the bullrope match against Dustin Rhodes.  I hope I'm not the only guy in the world who liked this match.  The cowbell on the rope is used a lot.  YEAH!  The audience cries out for blood several times, but doesn't see it until Dustin is attacked by Terry Funk of all people, after the end of the match.I should point out here that old Dusty Rhodes gives a pointless interview segment sometime in the pay per view about how sad he is that he's not there.  Of course, you can't understand half of what he's saying.  I was listening carefully for the word, "mothership," but I don't think he said it.Flair defends his title against Barry Windam in a match that looked fairly short to me.  He tries the figure-4 several times to no avail, but then gets the win out of nowhere.  We see a great superplex from Windam.  I love that move.  One thing I couldn't understand is why the International title got top billing here, and the WCW title match was midcard.  Probably had to do with some backstage politics that WCW was notorious for.  Note - Heenan leaves the commentary position just before this match.The tag title match is the best on the card.  Basically it's just the Nasty Boys, Cactus, and Sullivan hitting each other with stuff.  Plenty of overuse of flattened out trashcans.  One of the participants gets tossed into the laps of some people in the front row.  Probably scared the heck out of them.  Reminds me of when Rob Van Dam used to do those flipping jumps into the audience back in authentic ECW.  One thing this match made me think about is the career of the Nasty Boys.  The Nasty Boys probably fit in better with WCW than WWF.Last match is Sting vs. Vader for the International title in one of Sting's better matches.  He even gives Vader an impressive vertical suplex.  Vader's mask is off for a good portion of the match.  The big man does a beautiful moonsault that misses, and when Harley Race tries to cheat to break up a pinfall, he accidentally nails Vader right in the face with a toprope headbutt.  Oops.  Sting capitalizes to get the win.  I guess the Stinger won a vacant title, I'm not really sure.Lots of old wrestling legends are inducted into the WCW hall of fame here in 1994.  I wonder if the WCW hall of fame meshed with the WWE hall of fame when it was bought.  I don't think so because Vern Gagne was inducted into the WWE hall of fame very recently.  It's funny to see him and Lou Thez react to the tag title street fight match.  They probably wouldn't have went professional if they had to change their style that much.  I'm surprised Kurt Angle has adjusted so well myself.I highly recommend this pay per view.  Lots of in-ring action, even if the match build-up is terrible.
Title: N/A
